title: 109_hr100
content: The Act may be cited as the "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act". It includes provisions for judicial review of orders of removal. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to include provisions for judicial review of orders of removal, including habeas corpus provisions from title 28 of the United States Code. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow judicial review of orders of removal, specifically for claims under the United Nations Convention Against Torture and Other Forms of Cruel, Inhuman, or Degrading Treatment or Punishment through a petition filed with an appropriate court of appeals. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to establish a petition for review as the exclusive means for judicial review of removal orders, except for claims under the United Nations Convention Against Torture and Other Forms of Cruel, Inhuman, or Degrading Treatment or Punishment. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to establish exclusive judicial review through a petition for removal orders, with limitations on habeas corpus jurisdiction for certain provisions. The amendments take effect upon enactment of the Act. The "Citizens and Legal Immigration Act" amends Section 242 of the Immigration and Nationality Act to establish exclusive judicial review through a petition for removal orders, with limitations on habeas corpus jurisdiction for certain provisions. Cases challenging final administrative removal orders will be transferred from district courts to the court of appeals for review.
